title: Memorial Van Damme
text:
The Memorial Van Damme is an annual <a href="Athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a> event at the <a href="King%20Baudouin%20Stadium">King Baudouin Stadium</a> in <a href="Brussels">Brussels</a>, <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a> that takes place in late August or early September. Previously one of the <a href="IAAF%20Golden%20League">IAAF Golden League</a> events, it is now the final event of the <a href="Diamond%20League">Diamond League</a>, along with <a href="Weltklasse%20Z%C3%BCrich">Weltklasse Zürich</a>.
It was first organized in 1977 by a group of journalists in honour of <a href="Ivo%20Van%20Damme">Ivo Van Damme</a>, a Belgian double medal winner at the <a href="1976%20Summer%20Olympics">Montreal Olympics</a> who was killed the previous year in a car accident at the age of 22.
World records.
Over the course of its history, numerous <a href="List%20of%20world%20records%20in%20athletics">world records</a> have been set at Memorial Van Damme.
